ticTacToe

Class QLearningAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ticTacToe.Agent
      • ticTacToe.QLearningAgent

  • public class QLearningAgent
extends Agent
    A Q-Learning agent with a Q-Table, i.e. a table of Q-Values. This table is implemented in the QTable class. The methods to implement are: (1) train() (2) extractPolicy() Your agent acts in a TTTEnvironment which provides the method TTTEnvironment.executeMove(ticTacToe.Move) which returns an Outcome object, in other words an [s,a,r,s']: source state, action taken, reward received, and the target state after the opponent has played their move. You may want/need to edit TTTEnvironment - but you probably won't need to.
    Author:
    ae187

    • Field Detail

      • alpha

        double alpha
        The learning rate, between 0 and 1.

      • numEpisodes

        int numEpisodes
        The number of episodes to train for

      • discount

        double discount
        The discount factor (gamma)

      • epsilon

        double epsilon
        The epsilon in the epsilon greedy policy used during training.

      • qTable

        QTable qTable
        This is the Q-Table. To get an value for an (s,a) pair, i.e. a (game, move) pair, you can do qTable.get(game).get(move) which return the Q(game,move) value stored. Be careful with cases where there is currently no value. You can use the containsKey method to check if the mapping is there.

      • env

        TTTEnvironment env
        This is the Reinforcement Learning environment that this agent will interact with when it is training. By default, the opponent is the random agent which should make your q learning agent learn the same policy as your value iteration and policy iteration agents.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QLearningAgent

        public QLearningAgent(Agent opponent,
                      double learningRate,
                      int numEpisodes,
                      double discount)
        Construct a Q-Learning agent that learns from interactions with opponent.
        Parameters:
        opponent - the opponent agent that this Q-Learning agent will interact with to learn.
        learningRate - This is the rate at which the agent learns. Alpha from your lectures.
        numEpisodes - The number of episodes (games) to train for

      • QLearningAgent

        public QLearningAgent()
        Uses default parameters for the opponent (a RandomAgent) and the learning rate (0.2). Use other constructor to set these manually.

    • Method Detail

      • initQTable

        protected void initQTable()
        Initialises all valid q-values -- Q(g,m) -- to 0.

      • train

        public void train()
        Implement this method. It should play this.numEpisodes episodes of Tic-Tac-Toe with the TTTEnvironment, updating q-values according to the Q-Learning algorithm as required. The agent should play according to an epsilon-greedy policy where with the probability epsilon the agent explores, and with probability 1-epsilon, it exploits. At the end of this method you should always call the extractPolicy() method to extract the policy from the learned q-values. This is currently done for you on the last line of the method.

      • extractPolicy

        public Policy extractPolicy()
        Implement this method. It should use the q-values in the qTable to extract a policy and return it.
        Returns:
        the policy currently inherent in the QTable

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] a)
                 throws IllegalMoveException
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException
